title: OpenSea NFT bulk upload failing - metadata format issues?
content:
I'm trying to upload a 10,000 NFT collection to OpenSea but the bulk import keeps failing. Getting "Invalid metadata format" for ~30% of my NFTs.

**My metadata structure:**
```json
{
  "name": "CyberPunk #1234",
  "description": "Unique cyberpunk character with rare traits",
  "image": "ipfs://QmX1Y2Z3.../1234.png",
  "external_url": "https://mycollection.com/nft/1234",
  "attributes": [
    {
      "trait_type": "Background",
      "value": "Neon City"
    },
    {
      "trait_type": "Rarity Score", 
      "value": 87.5,
      "display_type": "number"
    },
    {
      "trait_type": "Generation",
      "value": "Gen 1"
    }
  ],
  "animation_url": "ipfs://QmA1B2C3.../1234.mp4"
}
```

**Issues I'm seeing:**
1. Some NFTs show "Failed to load metadata" on OpenSea
2. Traits not appearing correctly in rarity rankings
3. Images load but videos (animation_url) don't play

**My setup:**
- Metadata: Pinned on Pinata IPFS
- Images: 512x512 PNG, <500KB each
- Videos: 10-second MP4 loops, <2MB each
- Contract: ERC-721A on Ethereum mainnet

**Questions:**
1. Is my metadata format OpenSea-compliant?
2. Should I use different IPFS gateway?
3. Any issues with mixing images + videos in same collection?
4. How long does OpenSea take to refresh metadata?

This is for a major launch next week - really need to fix this!
